data.title: Windows 10: integrated terminal cut off to the top

data.title: Hide the tsdk_version setting from the user
data.body:
Currently there are 2 similar setting for defining the TS version:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/18206676/02b90e14-7128-11e6-9220-807124c341d9.png)

To make this more clear we should hide the development setting tsdk_version.

data.title: find a better way to cache objects between main and ext host
data.body: In the extension host we often cache objects for a certain period of time. For instance those are command arguments, completion items and code lenses that need resolving, code action etc. We employ some sketchy mechanism to cache and clear them - mostly as long until the next request comes in. That has issues if you make requests if you make request in parallel and needs for a better solution

data.title: Auto-completion for `import from '..'` file address
data.body:
It would be nice if editor provided auto completion for `import from` file names

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/18206189/fc11d1ba-713e-11e6-93a6-dd9ff88e52d5.png)

data.title: [explorer] folder icon is always expanded
data.body:
- drag a file from a folder to top level
- The folder icons in the explorer are always open, even if the twisty is collapsed

data.title: Fixes #11451 - Add `konsole` as default terminal for KDE-plasma
Debugger doesn't recognize `konsole` as a terminal on Kubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Kubuntu 14.04

The debugger can't start due to the following error:

> Error: unable to start debugging. No terminal is available to launch the debugger. Please install Gnome Terminal or XTerm.

IMHO, it's not a good idea to mix KDE and gnome (especially low level things like terminals), so many KDE users wouldn't have one of those two installed. Instead, vscode should recognize `konsole` as a terminal application.

Interestingly, the integrated terminal works just fine.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make a c++ project 
2. Configure a launch
3. Press the green triangle

data.title: [JS] IntelliSense disregards properties if prototype defined by assigning object
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607
- Language: JavaScript

I observed that IntelliSense disregards any property inherited from the object's prototype in case the prototype is defined by assigning an object. For example, IntelliSense does not show property 'greet' in the screenshot below.
![vscode-intellisense-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21695902/18188632/06e87f54-708a-11e6-96e0-4e787e506b7e.jpg)

IntelliSense only lists an inherited prototype property in case it is defined individually (see second screenshot).
![vscode-intellisense-01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21695902/18188606/ddd89b6c-7089-11e6-9c4d-1c45cf6b959f.jpg)

I would expect that IntelliSense presents inherited properties also in case the object's prototype is defined by assigning an object.

data.body:
Extracted from #11187

Debug console shows proposals for `5`. Eg: `toString()`. 
But applying them shows error.

data.title: Integrated terminal jerky scrolling with scrollbar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-insider commit bd35113a
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio Window.
2. Press CTRL + ' to open Integrated Terminal.
3. type some command that will generate a couple of pages of output. e.g. execute twice **ipconfig** command
4. Try to grab scrollbar and scroll up and down.

Expected behavior:
The console output scrolling is synchronized with the scrollbar position giving smooth scrolling experience.

Actual behavior:
The console output scrolling is jerky. It's position is only refreshed about once a second.

data.title: Conflict of vscode node definitions with @types/node
data.body:
While developing extension, some modules may require node definitions they install it as dependency in `@types/node`

But then there appear many errors of duplicate indentifier:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/18201847/f139c6f8-7125-11e6-8db4-f0993526f4a0.png)

If to remove `@types/node` those modules that require it, error that can not find definitions:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/18201797/961527e0-7125-11e6-9ead-d894a033d4ab.png)

It is possible to resolve the conflict?

I only installed eslint plugin as linter, but for some js files I noticed there are some [js] error prompts as following:

![capture d ecran 2016-09-02 a 12 13 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3535692/18200836/12faee62-7107-11e6-848d-65b8e2c61a53.png)

I just want to know what this linter is and how to turn it off (I didn't install anything related, and prompts form eslint will start with [eslint])

data.title: Picker: onDidSelectItem no longer being called
data.body:
Tried to verify https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7019 and noticed that `onDidSelectItem`  is no longer being called upon navigating over picker entries.

I think the root cause is `asWinJsPromise` (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/async.ts#L26) that is used from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/node/mainThreadQuickOpen.ts#L50 does not handle the progress part of WinJS promises at all, but this is how the selected item travels from the quick open service.

data.title: VS Code can't recognize some Unicode
Show an information dialog if settings can not be accessed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
From verifying #10317:
- remove permissions to read `~/.config/Code - Insiders/storage.json`
- start VSCode
- VSCode starts up without error message. No folder history, but all seems to work.

Starting `code --verbose` shows the issue

A warning dialog or message (also without verbose) would be good so the user can fix the permission issue.

data.title: Terminal does not scroll up
data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest insiders
- OS Version: OS X, zsh shell

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal, have lots of output
2. Can not scroll up. Vertical scroll bar is not appearing, also tried the mouse well but can not scroll up

I also see this behavior in our stable VSCode build so not a regression

data.title: Preserve tabs when opened intentionally
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version:  Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  <kbd>ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>p</kbd> 
2.  Type some file name
3.  Press <kbd>Enter</kbd>
4.  When above three steps did again, the previously opened file is disappearing.

VS Code should keep the file when user Intentionally opened it.  Currently, it is showing the file in italics (stating that the tab isn't preserved).

data.title: Save All - keyboard shortcut should use VS binding
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Visual Studio (IDE) has the Save All keyboard shortcut of (Ctrl+Shift+S), the same shortcut is available in code but it actions the Save As... function.

Can you apply the same to VS Code? I use both daily, like many other developers.

It would be nice to keep the same functionality between both Microsoft products.

data.title: RPM package lacks shortcut in PATH
data.body:
Just installed the Insiders RPM package in CentOS and `code-insiders` wasn't placed on the `$PATH`:

```
➜  ~ sudo find / -name 'code-insiders'
find: ‘/run/user/1000/gvfs’: Permission denied
/usr/share/code-insiders
/usr/share/code-insiders/bin/code-insiders
/usr/share/code-insiders/code-insiders
➜  ~ which code-insiders
/usr/bin/which: no code-insiders in (/home/joao/.nvm/versions/node/v5.10.1/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin:/bin:/sbin:/home/joao/bin)
```

data.title: Typescript Linter & Intellisense unexpected behaviour
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:49:32.489Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-36-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start the `vscode`.
2. Does not have linting support for files just opened.
3. Restart the app to have it support again.
4. If any new files are opened, goto step 2.

I have to restart again and again just to have intellisense for the file.

data.title: Appveyor: show output also for normal unit tests
Bug: An Image doesn't change in the editor whenever it is altered externally
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: macOS El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project/folder containing an image
2. In the Folder view, select the image in order to show it in the editor window (tried with a PNG)
3. Replace the image file externally (tried with macOS Finder)
4. In the Folder view, select another file and select back the image

Observation:
The image doesn't change. It keeps showing the old image. It is needed to restart VSCode in order to see the updated image.

Expected:
The updated image shall be shown.
